headline: Sneha Ghosh Joins S4 Capital's Monks as EVP Data, NAMER
summary: Monks—the global, digital-first, data-driven, unitary operating brand of S4 Capital plc—has appointed long-time data visionary Sneha Ghosh as EVP Data, NAMER to accelerate the development of sophisticated data modeling across the company's marketing services solutions. Sneha joins the company to lead the North American data team and will report to Bryan Sherman, EVP, Head of NAMER Media and Data at Monks.

Sneha joins the company to lead the North American data team and will report to Bryan Sherman, EVP, Head of NAMER Media and Data at Monks.

headline: Data Center Capex Up 59 Percent on Continued AI Investment in 3Q 2025, According to Dell'Oro Group

headline: Amazon, Apple, Google, etc.: Why the Mag 7 needs to 'recalibrate'
summary: The S&P 500 (^GSPC) is concentrated primarily in the top ten technology stocks, according to Barclays. PNC Asset Management Group chief investment officer Amanda Agati, Yahoo Finance Senior Business Reporter Ines Ferré, and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma join Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to discuss the market's concentration in tech and whether it's time for investors to start selling the "Magnificent Seven." To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Reply Recognized as a Microsoft Azure Expert Managed Services Provider for the Sixth Consecutive Year
summary: TURIN, Italy, December 18, 2025--Reply [EXM, STAR: REY] announced today it has been recognized once again as a Microsoft Azure Expert Managed Services Provider (MSP). The renewal reaffirms Reply’s proven expertise and consistent track record in delivering high-quality cloud solutions and services on the Microsoft Azure platform, powered by the deep technical expertise of its specialized companies – Cluster Reply, Solidsoft Reply and Valorem Reply.

content.title: Reply Recognized as a Microsoft Azure Expert Managed Services Provider for the Sixth Consecutive Year
content.summary: TURIN, Italy, December 18, 2025--Reply [EXM, STAR: REY] announced today it has been recognized once again as a Microsoft Azure Expert Managed Services Provider (MSP). The renewal reaffirms Reply’s proven expertise and consistent track record in delivering high-quality cloud solutions and services on the Microsoft Azure platform, powered by the deep technical expertise of its specialized companies – Cluster Reply, Solidsoft Reply and Valorem Reply.

thumbnail.caption: This recognition reflects the ongoing collaboration between Reply - through its companies Cluster Reply, Solidsoft Reply, and Valorem Reply - and Microsoft, supporting shared efforts to deliver value-driven services to enterprise customers.

headline: Is Microsoft (MSFT) Fairly Valued After Its Recent 6% Pullback?
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) has pulled back roughly 6% over the past month, even as its long term returns remain strong. That dip has investors asking whether the current price better reflects future growth. See our latest analysis for Microsoft. Zooming out, that 6.2% 1 month share price pullback and similarly soft 3 month share price return come after a strong year to date gain and an almost doubling 3 year total shareholder return. This suggests momentum is cooling rather than collapsing. If...

headline: OpenAI has discussed raising tens of billions at about $750 billion valuation: The Information
summary: OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising funds at a ​valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported ‌on Wednesday.  Reuters could not immediately verify the report and OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  If finalized, ⁠the talks would represent ‌a roughly 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October, following a deal ‍in which current and former employees sold about $6.6 billion worth of shares.

content.title: OpenAI has discussed raising tens of billions at about $750 billion valuation: The Information
content.summary: OpenAI has held preliminary talks with some investors about raising funds at a ​valuation of around $750 billion, the Information reported ‌on Wednesday.  Reuters could not immediately verify the report and OpenAI did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  If finalized, ⁠the talks would represent ‌a roughly 50% jump from OpenAI's reported $500 billion valuation in October, following a deal ‍in which current and former employees sold about $6.6 billion worth of shares.

headline: Cognizant and Microsoft Expand Partnership to Advance AI Transformation and Frontier Firm Experiences
summary: Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) today announced a multi-year strategic partnership with Microsoft to help global enterprises become AI-powered frontier firms: organizations that redefine work, unlock new value, and scale innovation responsibly.
